notes.text:
The filling should have a slight wobble
Best served chilled
Use unwaxed lemons for the zest

steps.descr: Roll out pastry and line a tart tin, chill 30 mins

on_enter.say: Right, let's roll out that lovely pastry and line our tart tin. Once that's done, pop it in the fridge to chill for 30 minutes. This will help it hold its shape beautifully.

steps.instructions: Roll out pastry and line a tart tin, chill 30 mins

on_enter.say: Now, let's blind bake our pastry at 180°C for 20 minutes. You want it to be nice and golden. The smell will be amazing!

steps.descr: Whisk eggs, yolks, sugar, lemon zest and juice

on_enter.say: Let's get whisking! Combine the eggs, yolks, sugar, lemon zest, and juice until it's all smooth and lovely. It should smell fresh and citrusy.

steps.instructions: Whisk eggs, yolks, sugar, lemon zest and juice

on_enter.say: Now, gently stir in the cream. This will make our filling rich and silky. Look at that beautiful texture!
Let's carefully pour the filling into our prepared pastry case. Make sure it's nice and even.

steps.descr: Bake at 140°C for 35-40 minutes until just set

on_enter.say: Time to bake our tart at 140°C for 35 to 40 minutes. It should be just set with a slight wobble in the middle. Your kitchen will smell divine!

steps.instructions: Bake at 140°C for 35-40 minutes until just set

steps.descr: Cool completely, dust with icing sugar

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Let the tart cool completely, then give it a lovely dusting of icing sugar. It's going to be a showstopper!

steps.instructions: Cool completely, dust with icing sugar

recipe.title: Lemon Tart
recipe.description: Tangy, smooth lemon curd in a buttery pastry shell
